title: Ducks G Gibson lands three-year extension
content:
The Anaheim Ducks inked young goaltender John Gibson to a three-year contract extension on Monday. 
 
The 22-year-old Gibson will make $6.9 million over the course of the extension. His yearly salaries will be $1.5 million in 2016-17, $2.1 million in 2017-18 and $3.3 million in 2018-19. 

Gibson started 21 games for the Ducks last season and went 13-8 with a 2.60 goals-against average. 

He could start the upcoming campaign in the minors with Frederik Anderson entrenched as the starter and recently acquired Anton Khudobin set to be the backup.
